alert.note: Alert for Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 15 at 7:51PM CDT until July 18 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Woodward affecting Woodward County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Woodward. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of croplands... pastures... oil wells... and rural roads... extends along the river from the northwestern through the central and southeastern sections of Woodward County. Flooding affects areas near Fort Supply several hours before the crest reaches the Woodward vicinity and points downstream. Cattle and other property should be moved to locations 1 foot higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded for hours by high water in side channels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to remain at a crest of 10.0 feet until just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 800 AM CDT.
